definition: individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general

sentences.english: Thieves and burglars nation and personal information still have personal privacy.
sentences.chinese: 盗窃国家和个人信息还有个人隐私。

sentences.english: Talking about wearing a bone, said Xie Xiaonuo belong to personal privacy.
sentences.chinese: 聊起戴骨顺，谢小诺说属于个人隐私。

sentences.english: Mr Snowden told the truth in the name of privacy.
sentences.chinese: 史诺顿以个人隐私的名义揭露真相。

sentences.english: But such private matters have a tendency to become public tragedies.
sentences.chinese: 但这样的个人隐私正趋向于成为社会的悲剧。

sentences.english: Goole today insisted there was no threat to privacy.
sentences.chinese: 古尔今天坚持，没有威胁到个人隐私。

definition: to infringe on/to encroach on/to violate/to assault
to take a picture of a person without permission or without their knowledge
to keep sth confidential/to maintain secrecy
to embezzle/to defraud/to use illegitimately/to misappropriate
to make known to the masses (idiom); to publicize widely/to let the world know

pinyin: she4 hui4 gong1 gong4 li4 yi4
